page.title: 13GUITING POWER.CONSERVATION
page.content: The Headquarters of the International Centre for Conservation Education is in the village of Guiting Power.They help to save animals from extinction. They make tapes and slides to teach people not to kill animals. Tapes are made in different languages especially French,which is widely spoken in Africa. African conservation workers then translate the scripts into the local language. The Centre equips vans with audio- visual equipment.The vans go to remote villages overseas to teach conservation. The Centre runs courses for overseas workers. A Kenyan once came to school to tell us about his country. We like to borrow their brass- rubbings of endangered species.
